item.title: Should be simple
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

you only initialized h2 in

Integer[][] l1, l2, h1, h2 = new Integer[20][20];

you have to do new integer[20][20] for each one

So like

Integer[][] l1 = new Integer[20][20], l2 = new Integer[20][20], h1 = new Integer[20][20], h2 = new Integer[20][20];

Read full topic

item.title: Should be simple
item.dc:creator: @Lorax Lorax
item.description:
@Lorax wrote:

Hey I am making this Equation displayer, and I get this error from it:

java.lang.NullPointerException at Equation.LoadParametres(Equation.java:30) at Equation.init(Equation.java:46) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(AppletPanel.java:378) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:613)

I am kind of new to this whole java thing and even though I used google I couldn’t find a answer which solved my problem.

line 30 is:

          l1[i][i2] = Integer.parseInt(tmp);

and the rest of the code causing the error is :

[code]import java.applet.Applet;
import java.awt.Graphics;

public class Equation extends Applet
{

Integer[][] l1, l2, h1, h2 = new Integer[20][20];
String[][] s1, s2 = new String[20][20];
String eq;
Integer middle, cX, dX, mDiv, i, i2;

public void LoadParametres()
{

String tmp;
eq = getParameter("equation");
middle = Integer.parseInt(getParameter("middle"));

for (i = 0; i < 20; i++)
{
  for (i2 = 0; i2 < 20; i2++)
  {
  
    tmp = getParameter((i+1) + ":" +( i2+1) + ":length1");

    if ( tmp != null )
    {

      l1[i][i2] = Integer.parseInt(tmp);
      l2[i][i2] = Integer.parseInt(getParameter(i.toString() + ":" + i2.toString() + ":length2"));
      h1[i][i2] = Integer.parseInt(getParameter(i.toString() + ":" + i2.toString() + ":height1"));
      h1[i][i2] = Integer.parseInt(getParameter(i.toString() + ":" + i2.toString() + ":height2"));
      s1[i][i2] = getParameter(i.toString() + ":" + i2.toString() + ":string1");
      s2[i][i2] = getParameter(i.toString() + ":" + i2.toString() + ":string2");
    } else {
      break;
    }
  }
}

}

public void init()
{
LoadParametres();
}[/code][br][size=1]Posted on: June 11, 2007, 04:48:45 PM[/size][hr]I’m sorry for the double topic post, it wasn’t intended - I am using a unsecured wireless network from someone in the area and it’s not the fastest

Read full topic
